pros: The company has beautiful offices and good employee benefits. Working as part of such a close team was very rewarding.
cons: Work can sometimes become isolated and mundane. Also, there was a slightly cliquey environment, which could have been improved a lot.

pros: I'm sure there is something. In fairness they use to have a great team they employed but gradually this has depleted. This and the CEO's had tried to uphold positive visions.
cons:
*restructure was setup to save money and keep people,at the top in a job leaving managers with heavy burdens and over worked hours.
*policies are always rewritten as they are inaccurate. They use one set of policies to cover varied ages and abilities, like including bottle feeding in with sure start or after school clubs.
*misslead staff in pay and make regular errors. Staff support based over the phone and bad information leading to additional pay problems.
*parents often feel clueless as to how billing works due to wrong calculations and no real consistency in how income in monitored.
*over arching view is not translated effectively.
*mamagement use cut throat tactics that do not exist within their sector.
*many settings do not have a welfare rights policy that is met.
*ofsted targets are achieved to meet the facade with no real children development.
*very target orientated
*work politics 
*managment staff use demoralising management techniques and catch phrases like watch your back.

pros:
Monday to Friday 9-5 working hours 
Met some nice people
cons: Procedures are always changing and then staff blamed by managers when things go wrong. Training only for the chosen few who have to feed back to colleagues. Staff told they are replaceable by managers who manage by bullying. High staff turnover and slow to fill vacancies. Very slow to pay bills, even had bailiffs turn up!!

job_title: Temp Financial Accountant in London, England
pros: A challenge, an opportunity to suggest improvements and to be allowed to make changes where necessary.
cons: Previously, poor internal controls had led to a backlog of work to do. Now completed.
